metadata.synopsis: Dialogue with Archivist in House of Hope. He is the person who keep records on all Raphael projects. Half-way between a curator and an accountant, he's incredibly repressed, and obsessed with record-keeping and accounts.He's the model of Order and tidiness, but being from the hells, he's also hiding a dark secret. In his case, he's a masochist, and finds the concept of breaking rules thrilling, though he hates to admit it.Strict and severe, he will try to keep order unless the player leans on his vices or fears, in which case he'll become flustered and dismiss them to the boudoir.

22.speaker: Archivist
22.text: This is delightful. You have what you wanted, but you cannot leave lest all hells break loose.
22.context: NodeContext: dripping with sarcasm and rising mania - delivered to somebody who stole from him and is about to die

9.speaker: Archivist
9.text: Ha ha. Ha ha ha! A ho-ho-hopeless situation. Ha ha ha ha ha!
9.context: NodeContext: trying to stifle laughter at first, then making the intentional 'ho ho ho' into hopeless joke before laughing manically and uncontrollably

39.speaker: Archivist
39.text: You claimed to be who you are not, stole from my master, and now you expect to leave?

5.speaker: Archivist
5.text: The moment you step outside this room, all hells will break loose.
5.context: NodeContext: dripping with sarcasm and rising mania - delivered to somebody who stole from him and is about to die

49.speaker: Archivist
49.text: Dishevelled and with a lingering odour of blood and sweat. I hope you found the boudoir to your liking.

55.speaker: Archivist
55.text: The master will deal with you when he returns. And I'll mop up whatever remains.
55.context: NodeContext: not angry, just dismissive. Wants us gone

56.speaker: Archivist
56.text: Not a limb out of place. Either you haven't visited the boudoir yet, or you're more robust than you look.
56.context: NodeContext: appraising player politely, mildly surprised to see them again

59.speaker: Archivist
59.text: Splendid to see you again, Inquisitor.

66.speaker: Archivist
66.text: A guest? Are you a client of the master, or a visitor from elsewhere in the Hells?
66.context: NodeContext: Inquisitive, thoughtful, eyeing up a visitor suspiciously

73.speaker: Archivist
73.text: I do not believe you were invited. One moment - I shall consult the visitors' schedule.
73.context: NodeContext: irritated. The schedule is not a physical object - it's kept in his mind.

133.speaker: Archivist
133.context: NodeContext: eyes closed as he pores through his memories... the 'hmmm'is like the sound you might make when looking through a list of appointments, or spreadsheet for a particular entry. Impatient.

125.speaker: Archivist
125.context: NodeContext: eyes closed as he pores through his memories... the 'hmmm'is like the sound you might make when looking through a list of appointments, or spreadsheet for a particular entry. Growing irritation as he can't find what he's looking for.

86.speaker: Player
86.text: *His eyes flicker back and forth as if he is reading a book. He has the schedule memorised... or it's carved into his eyelids.*
86.context: NodeContext: looking at the player suspiciously and a little bit predatory. Intentional rhyme

12.text: *His eyes flicker back and forth as if he is reading a book. He has the schedule memorised... or it's carved into his eyelids.*
12.context: NodeContext: looking at the player suspiciously and a little bit predatory. Intentional rhyme

127.speaker: Narrator
127.text: *His eyes flicker back and forth as if he is reading a book. He has the schedule memorised... or it's carved into his eyelids.*
127.context: NodeContext: looking at the player suspiciously and a little bit predatory. Intentional rhyme

74.speaker: Archivist
74.text: Most irregular. The schedule is all but clear. And yet you are here.
74.context: NodeContext: looking at the player suspiciously and a little bit predatory. Intentional rhyme

33.speaker: Player
33.text: I just want to explore the Archive.
33.context: NodeContext: welcoming, but with a sinister edge

90.speaker: Archivist
90.text: Be my guest. Even if you're not scheduled for an appointment, this is a civilised place.
90.context: NodeContext: welcoming, but with a sinister edge

51.speaker: Archivist
51.text: As long as you don't remove any of the artefacts, nobody will remove your skin.
51.context: NodeContext: polite, but with a sadistic smile

109.speaker: Archivist
109.text: Unless Master Raphael decides otherwise, of course.
109.context: NodeContext: polite, but with a sadistic smile

97.speaker: Player
97.text: Are there any highlights in the collection?
97.context: NodeContext: with reverence - he loves the collection, and this artefact most of all

96.speaker: Archivist
96.text: And of course, the Orphic Hammer itself is the prize of the collection.
96.context: NodeContext: with reverence - he loves the collection, and this artefact most of all

117.speaker: Archivist
117.text: The Orphic Hammer is one of Master Raphael's most prized possessions. You can't have it. You can't even touch it. And I would suggest you don't think about it.
117.context: NodeContext: with reverence - he loves the collection, and this artefact most of all - politely chiding the player for asking about it on the phrases starting 'you can't have it'

52.speaker: Player
52.text: I just want to admire the craftsmanship.
52.context: NodeContext: with reverence - he loves the collection, and this artefact most of all

2.speaker: Archivist
2.text: It is exquisite. The master cast it himself, you know, using metals gathered from the depths of the Hells.
2.context: NodeContext: with reverence - he loves the collection, and this artefact most of all

17.speaker: Archivist
17.text: It is exquisite. The master cast it himself, you know, using metals gathered from the depths of the Hells.
17.context: NodeContext: with reverence - he loves the collection, and this artefact most of all

25.text: Excellent! You can admire it with your eyes, from a distance.
25.context: NodeContext: faux-delight on the first word. Then sarcastic as he shooes the player away

11.speaker: Archivist
11.text: Excellent! You can admire it with your eyes, from a distance.
11.context: NodeContext: faux-delight on the first word. Then sarcastic as he shooes the player away

64.speaker: Player
64.text: How about I break bits of you until you change your mind?
64.context: NodeContext: with an exasperated sigh - sincere, but annoyed with himself

15.speaker: Player
15.text: I think I can use the Hammer to save the world.
15.context: NodeContext: with an exasperated sigh - sincere, but annoyed with himself

31.speaker: Archivist
31.text: The long centuries of pain and suffering must be making me sentimental.
31.context: NodeContext: with an exasperated sigh - sincere, but annoyed with himself

58.speaker: Archivist
58.text: The long centuries of pain and suffering must be making me sentimental.
58.context: NodeContext: with an exasperated sigh - sincere, but annoyed with himself

41.speaker: Archivist
41.text: If the Hammer can save millions of souls, who am I to stand in your way? After all, a saved world is a fine future prospect for exploitation.
41.context: NodeContext: first phrase is sincere, second phrase is is more sinister

63.text: Which world? There are so many, and so few of them are worth saving.

42.speaker: Archivist
42.text: Which world? There are so many, and so few of them are worth saving.

6.speaker: Archivist
6.text: No. I think the Hammer shall stay exactly where it is.
6.context: NodeContext: made up his mind. matter of fact

21.speaker: Player
21.text: I'm a client of Raphael's, and had second thoughts about the terms of my deal.

13.speaker: Archivist
13.text: I commend you! Thinking is a marvellous pastime.

135.speaker: Archivist
135.text: You should have third, fourth, and fifth thoughts about your deal as well. You can think about all the ways you're never going to break it.

68.speaker: Player
68.text: I don't want to break it - Raphael said I could make some edits and clarifications to the wording.

62.speaker: Archivist
62.text: Tsk. He can be so indulgent of his favourites.

50.speaker: Archivist
50.text: Tsk. He can be so indulgent of his favourites.

121.speaker: Archivist
121.text: While most irregular, I shall take your preposterous request into consideration.
121.context: NodeContext: annoyed, having to indulge a foolish request that he thinks is beneath his station

45.speaker: Archivist
45.text: Submitting the necessary paperwork will take no more than six infernal cycles, amounting to thirty-seven of your mortal years.
45.context: NodeContext: he loves the bureaucracy; he's very aware that the person he's talking to won't.

67.speaker: Archivist
67.text: I recommend you indulge in the pleasurable torments of the boudoir while you wait.
67.context: NodeContext: delivers this as if it's the most ordinary thing in the world to send someone to a 'boudoir' - same energy as a local council worker sending you to a waiting room

27.speaker: Archivist
27.text: Sadly, and to my shame, my key has slipped from my pocket. You will have to penetrate the boudoir's depths using your own cunning.
27.context: NodeContext: hand-off small key-like device off-screen on final phrase. No need for object to be visible. Big emphasis on the 'and'. He's more interested in the business than the pleasure.

82.speaker: Archivist
82.text: Sadly, and to my shame, my key has slipped from my pocket. You will have to penetrate the boudoir's depths using your own cunning.
82.context: NodeContext: hand-off small key-like device off-screen on final phrase. No need for object to be visible. Big emphasis on the 'and'. He's more interested in the business than the pleasure.

57.speaker: Archivist
57.text: It is where Raphael conducts his most private matters of business and pleasure. You will need this to gain access.
57.context: NodeContext: hand-off small key-like device off-screen on final phrase. No need for object to be visible. Big emphasis on the 'and'. He's more interested in the business than the pleasure.

19.speaker: Archivist
19.text: The resident favours their favourites. Satisfy them, and they may put in a good word on your behalf.
19.context: NodeContext: he's ending hte conversation here, and returning to his work. Glad to be done with us after offering this final tidbit of advice

131.speaker: Archivist
131.text: Why not wait here until the master returns? He'll be able to verify your extraordinary claim immediately.
131.context: NodeContext: With a smile - he knows this is a terrible offer - the player really doesn't want to meet 'the Master'(Raphael)

108.speaker: Player
108.text: How about I break bits of you until you tell me how to get what I want?

8.speaker: Archivist
8.text: I'd rather you didn't. My spine has only just healed from the last time the master shattered it.

80.speaker: Archivist
80.text: I'd rather you didn't. My spine has only just healed from the last time the master shattered it.

30.speaker: Archivist
30.text: Wholly deserved, of course. I spilled a glass of Baatezu Blood Wine on one of his favourite portraits.
30.context: NodeContext: BAH-teh-zu (a kind of devil, but here used as a sort of brand name). regretful

83.speaker: Archivist
83.text: Perhaps you could work off some of this aggression in the boudoir.
83.context: NodeContext: delivers this as if it's the most ordinary thing in the world to send someone to a 'boudoir' - same energy as a local council worker sending you to a waiting room

29.text: There are few bits of me that haven't been broken already.

53.speaker: Archivist
53.text: There are few bits of me that haven't been broken already.

123.speaker: Archivist
123.text: You're more than welcome to do your very worst. I'll have the guards stop you if it starts to tickle.

137.speaker: Player
137.text: Raphael won't care about losing one measly contract. Just let me have it, and I'll leave.
137.context: NodeContext: extremely irritated, but not losing his veneer of polite bureaucracy

48.speaker: Archivist
48.text: Your presence is already an irritant more distressing than the stings of a thousand hellwasps, so I would prefer that you do leave.
48.context: NodeContext: extremely irritated, but not losing his veneer of polite bureaucracy

118.speaker: Archivist
118.text: Your presence is already an irritant more distressing than the stings of a thousand hellwasps, so I would prefer that you do leave.
118.context: NodeContext: extremely irritated, but not losing his veneer of polite bureaucracy

124.speaker: Archivist
124.text: Take your insolent buzzing to the boudoir. You won't learn any manners there, but you might expand your imagination.
124.context: NodeContext: delivers this as if it's the most ordinary thing in the world to send someone to a 'boudoir' - same energy as a local council worker sending you to a waiting room

92.speaker: Archivist
92.text: Or have your tongue twisted so tightly you won't be able to bother me with your outrageous requests.

129.text: I'm afraid you don't realise quite how much you mean to the master. He would be inconsolable if he lost that contract.
129.context: NodeContext: faux-respectful, but really he's turning down our request

70.speaker: Archivist
70.text: I'm afraid you don't realise quite how much you mean to the master. He would be inconsolable if he lost that contract.
70.context: NodeContext: faux-respectful, but really he's turning down our request

132.speaker: Archivist
132.text: But if you're so keen to break it, why not wait until he comes home and discuss the matter with him face-to-face?
132.context: NodeContext: With a smile - he knows this is a terrible offer - the player really doesn't want to meet 'the Master'(Raphael)

107.speaker: Player
107.text: I am Karlach Demonsbane. I represent my mistress, Archduchess Zariel, and am acting as her High Inquisitor.
107.context: NodeContext: servile in the extreme - thinks he's talking to an incredibly important person

134.speaker: Player
134.text: I am Verillius Receptor, Zariel's High Inquisitor.
134.context: NodeContext: servile in the extreme - thinks he's talking to an incredibly important person

38.text: A thousand apologies, oh majestic magistrate of the infernal court! Your mortal guise is so vile, I found it perfectly convincing.
38.context: NodeContext: servile in the extreme - thinks he's talking to an incredibly important person

77.speaker: Archivist
77.text: A thousand apologies, oh majestic magistrate of the infernal court! Your mortal guise is so vile, I found it perfectly convincing.
77.context: NodeContext: servile in the extreme - thinks he's talking to an incredibly important person

23.speaker: Archivist
23.text: I would prostrate myself before you and kiss your calluses, but my spine is ruptured in a thousand places.

4.speaker: Archivist
4.text: You do know how Raphael likes to play.
4.context: NodeContext: apologetic and with a slight grin

85.speaker: Archivist
85.text: As always, the Archive is yours to peruse. You'll find everything accounted for, and I can present documents of procurement if necessary.

130.speaker: Player
130.text: I'm looking for a particular contract, belonging to [GEN_PlayerName_c11eee1e-7815-6143-7233-f2427799fa53].
130.context: NodeContext: curator proudly describing artefacts in a collection

40.speaker: Archivist
40.text: Of course, of course. It is highly prized due to the unique potential of the soul it is bound to.
40.context: NodeContext: curator proudly describing artefacts in a collection

71.speaker: Archivist
71.text: I don't understand the appeal of them myself, but Raphael does dote after mortals so.
71.context: NodeContext: like a butler joking about his superior in an affectionate way - 'you know how he is'

46.speaker: Archivist
46.text: As part of the special collection, that item is guarded by a masterword that even I do not know.
46.context: NodeContext: curator proudly describing artefacts in a collection

126.speaker: Archivist
126.text: I suggest you wait until Raphael returns, and you can discuss the matter with him. You are welcome to relax in the boudoir until then.

98.speaker: Archivist
98.text: The resident of the boudoir will wish to explore every inch of your new form. And I'm sure you would be happy to share.

3.speaker: Player
3.text: I'd like to see the Hammer, please.
3.context: NodeContext: curator proudly describing artefacts in a collection

26.speaker: Archivist
26.text: An exquisite and most unique artefact. Crafted with materials hewn from the depths of the Hells by Raphael's merregon labour force.
26.context: NodeContext: curator proudly describing artefacts in a collection

75.speaker: Archivist
75.text: As it was created by Raphael himself, we have no documents of procurement, nor do we require any. But if you wish to examine the artefact itself, you are more than welcome.
75.context: NodeContext: curator proudly describing artefacts in a collection

34.speaker: Player
34.text: Could I take a look at the Crown of Karsus?
34.context: NodeContext: nervous laughter - this is an uncomfortable topic

105.speaker: Archivist
105.text: Ha ha. Ahem. Most droll, Inquisitor. As you well know, the Crown of Karsus is lost.
105.context: NodeContext: nervous laughter - this is an uncomfortable topic

54.speaker: Archivist
54.text: Stolen from Mephistopheles by gods-kissing mortals. My master certainly had nothing to do with any of that business.
54.context: NodeContext: nervous laughter - this is an uncomfortable topic

44.speaker: Player
44.text: I might have to confiscate some of these artefacts.

114.speaker: Archivist
114.text: You may examine them, oh diabolical dominatrix, but they cannot be removed unless you present a writ of Infernal Requisition, with Article 152 correctly filled out.

119.speaker: Player
119.text: Any new highlights in the collection?
119.context: NodeContext: curator proudly describing artefacts in a collection

112.speaker: Archivist
112.text: A fine pair of gauntlets that allow the wearer to twist the head from even the most resilient malingerer.
112.context: NodeContext: curator proudly describing artefacts in a collection

89.speaker: Archivist
89.text: An amulet that causes the blood to surge, and the heart to swell. Along with other parts. Most invigorating.
89.context: NodeContext: curator proudly describing artefacts in a collection

65.speaker: Archivist
65.text: And, awaiting installation, we have secured a rod that gathers the Weave around it in great quantities, just as surely as shit gathers flies.
65.context: NodeContext: curator proudly describing artefacts in a collection

76.speaker: Player
76.text: I am Verillius Receptor, Zariel's High Inquisitor.

101.speaker: Archivist
101.text: You most certainly are not. And whoever you are, you are already trying my extremely limited patience.

87.speaker: Player
87.text: Access the schedule by reading his thoughts.

61.speaker: Archivist
61.text: Trying to see my thoughts? There are too many - and they're all mine!

43.speaker: Archivist
43.text: Trying to see my thoughts? There are too many - and they're all mine!

60.text: No visitors expected other than Korrilla Hearthflame and Verillius Receptor, Zariel's High Inquisitor.
60.context: NodeContext: calmly as if reading from a list of appointments

93.speaker: Archivist
93.text: No visitors expected other than Korrilla Hearthflame and Verillius Receptor, Zariel's High Inquisitor.
93.context: NodeContext: calmly as if reading from a list of appointments

72.speaker: Archivist
72.text: All visitors arrived on schedule. Korrilla Hearthflame wished to peruse the Archive, and the Inquisitor was in a most grotesque form.
72.context: NodeContext: calmly as if reading from a list of appointments

7.speaker: Archivist
7.text: Yes. Nasty little gadfly. I'd swat her if the master wasn't so fond of tormenting her.

88.speaker: Player
88.context: NodeContext: Responding to something nasty said

115.speaker: Karlach
115.context: NodeContext: Responding to something nasty said

111.speaker: Archivist
111.text: You are stupendously lugubrious this day, High Inquisitor. An inspiration to us all.

116.speaker: Archivist
116.context: NodeContext: annoyed, wants to get back to work
